intro: Neolitsea daibuensis, commonly known as the Daibu sweetgum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are usually dark green on top and lighter underneath. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by oval, woody fruits. Neolitsea daibuensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate to subtropical climates.
